Module flag4j
Package org.flag4j.arrays.dense

Class CTensor64

java.lang.Object
org.flag4j.arrays.backend_new.AbstractTensor<CTensor64,Field<Complex64>[],Complex64>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.TensorOverSemiRing<CTensor64,CTensor64,Field<Complex64>[],Complex64>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.TensorOverRing<CTensor64,CTensor64,Field<Complex64>[],Complex64>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.TensorOverField<CTensor64,CTensor64,Field<Complex64>[],Complex64>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.FieldTensorBase<CTensor64,CTensor64,Complex64>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.DenseFieldTensorBase<CTensor64,CooCTensor64,Complex64>
org.flag4j.arrays.dense.CTensor64
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, DenseTensorMixin<CTensor64,CooCTensor64>, TensorBinaryOpsMixin<CTensor64,CTensor64>, TensorMixin<CTensor64,Field<Complex64>[],Complex64>
public class CTensor64 extends DenseFieldTensorBase<CTensor64,CooCTensor64,Complex64>

A dense complex tensor backed by an array of Complex128's.

The AbstractTensor.entries of a tensor are mutable but the AbstractTensor.shape is fixed.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • CTensor64

      public CTensor64(Shape shape, Field<Complex64>[] entries)
      Creates a tensor with the specified entries and shape.
      Parameters:
      shape - Shape of this tensor.
      entries - Entries of this tensor. If this tensor is dense, this specifies all entries within the tensor. If this tensor is sparse, this specifies only the non-zero entries of the tensor.

    • CTensor64

      public CTensor64(Shape shape)
      Creates a zero tensor with the specified shape.
      Parameters:
      shape - Shape of this tensor.

    • CTensor64

      public CTensor64(Shape shape, Complex64 fillValue)
      Creates a tensor with the specified shape and filled with fillValue.
      Parameters:
      shape - Shape of this tensor.
      fillValue - Value to fill this tensor with.

    • CTensor64

      public CTensor64(Shape shape, String fillValue)
      Creates a tensor with the specified shape and filled with fillValue.
      Parameters:
      shape - Shape of this tensor.
      fillValue - Value to fill this tensor with. Must be a string representation of a complex number.

    • CTensor64

      public CTensor64(Shape shape, String[] entries)

      Creates a tensor with the specified entries and shape.

      String array must contain properly formatted string representation of complex numbers.

      Parameters:
      shape - Shape of this tensor.
      entries - Entries of this tensor. If this tensor is dense, this specifies all entries within the tensor. If this tensor is sparse, this specifies only the non-zero entries of the tensor.
      Throws:
      ComplexNumberParsingException - If any entry in entries is not a properly formatted string representation of complex number.

      Parameters:

      entries - Entries of the tensor to construct.

    • toCoo

      public CooCTensor64 toCoo()
      Converts this dense tensor to an equivalent sparse COO tensor.
      Returns:
      A sparse COO tensor equivalent to this dense tensor.

    • round

      public CTensor64 round()
      Rounds this tensor to the nearest whole number. If the tensor is complex, both the real and imaginary component will be rounded independently.
      Returns:
      A copy of this tensor with each entry rounded to the nearest whole number.

    • round

      public CTensor64 round(int precision)
      Rounds a matrix to the nearest whole number. If the matrix is complex, both the real and imaginary component will be rounded independently.
      Parameters:
      precision - The number of decimal places to round to. This value must be non-negative.
      Returns:
      A copy of this matrix with rounded values.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If precision is negative.

    • roundToZero

      public CTensor64 roundToZero()
      Rounds values which are close to zero in absolute value to zero. If the tensor is complex, both the real and imaginary components will be rounded independently. By default, the values must be within Flag4jConstants.EPS_F32 of zero. To specify a threshold value see roundToZero(double).
      Returns:
      A copy of this tensor with rounded values.

    • roundToZero

      public CTensor64 roundToZero(double threshold)
      Rounds values which are close to zero in absolute value to zero.
      Parameters:
      threshold - Threshold for rounding values to zero. That is, if a value in this matrix is less than the threshold in absolute value then it will be rounded to zero. This value must be non-negative.
      Returns:
      A copy of this matrix with rounded values.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If threshold is negative.
